question: Successive discounts of 10%, 20% and 30% is equivalent to a single discount of :
explanation:
Single equivalent discount for successive discounts of 10% and 20%.
$latex = \\left ( 10+20-\\frac{20\\times 10}{100} \\right )\\% = 28\\%&s=1$
Single equivalent discount for 28% and 30%. 
$latex = \\left ( 28+30-\\frac{28\\times 30}{100} \\right )\\% = 49.6\\%&s=1$
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
